author: Staff Reporter
text:
It is believed to have been entangled in a fishing net

The dolphin is likely to have been entangled in a net —Photo: S.S. Kumar

The carcass of an Indo Pacific Humpback Dolphin was washed ashore at Alambarai Kuppam on Saturday morning.

The stranded dolphin was 252 cm long and found to weigh over 200 kg. It was identified to be an adult male.

Volunteers of the Tree Foundation examined the carcass and found cut marks on the posterior ventral side as well as deep injuries around the snout and neck area and haemorrhaging on the head.

The cause of death was probably entanglement in a fishing net, said Supraja Dharini, Chairperson of the Tree Foundation.

Volunteers of the foundation’s Marine Mammal Stranding and Rescue team buried the mammal 25 metres above the high tide line.

The adult male found at Alambarai Kuppam is likely

to have been entangled in a net
title: Dead dolphin washed ashore
